sk.net

Class SKServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sk.net.SKServer

  • public class SKServer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used for hosting a server with SKNet.
    Author:
    Alfred Sporre

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SKServer()
      Constructs a new server.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SKServer addConnection(java.net.Socket socket)
      Adds a client connection to this server and performs the initialization procedure.
      SKServer addPacketListener(SKPacketListener packetListener)
      Adds a packet listener to this server.
      SKServer bind(java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
      Binds the server socket to the specified InetSocketAddress.
      SKServer bind(java.lang.String hostname, int port)
      Binds the server socket to the specified host name and port.
      void disconnect(int clientID, java.lang.String msg)
      Disconnects the client with the specified id.
      SKConnection getConnection(int id)
      Returns the connection associated with the specified id.
      java.lang.String getHostAddress()
      Returns the host address of this server.
      java.lang.String getHostName()
      Returns the host name of this server.
      java.net.InetAddress getInetAddress()
      Returns the InetAddress of this server.

      Returns the local port of this server.
      int getMaxConnections()
      Returns the maximum number of client connections allowed.
      java.util.ArrayList<SKPacketListener> getPacketListeners()
      Returns a list containing all packet listeners associated with this server.
      java.net.ServerSocket getServerSocket()
      Returns the ServerSocket of this server.
      int getTimeout()
      Returns the SO-timeout for this server's ServerSocket.
      boolean isRunning()
      Returns whether or not this server is running.
      boolean send(int id, java.lang.Object packet)
      Sends a packet to the specified client.
      int[] sendToAll(java.lang.Object packet)
      Sends a packet to all clients on this server.
      int[] sendToAllExclude(java.lang.Object packet, int... ids)
      Sends a packet to all clients on this server except for the ones with the specified IDs.
      SKServer setMaxConnections(int maxConnections)
      Sets the number of maximum client connections allowed.
      SKServer setTimeout(int ms)
      Sets the SO-timeout for this server's ServerSocket.
      SKServer start()
      Starts all the underlying server threads.
      void stop(java.lang.String msg)
      Stops this server.

      • start

        public SKServer start()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Starts all the underlying server threads.
        Returns:
        this server instance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the server socket could not be opened
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there are no packet listeners associated with this server

                    java.lang.Object packet)
        Sends a packet to the specified client.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the receiving client
        packet - the packet to send
        Returns:
        true if the packet was sent successfully

      • sendToAll

        Sends a packet to all clients on this server.
        Parameters:
        packet - the packet to send
        Returns:
        the IDs of the connections that generated errors

      • sendToAllExclude

        public int[] sendToAllExclude(java.lang.Object packet,
                              int... ids)
        Sends a packet to all clients on this server except for the ones with the specified IDs.
        Parameters:
        packet - the packet to send
        ids - the IDs of the clients to exclude
        Returns:
        the IDs of the connections that generated errors

        msg - the disconnection message to send

        Returns:
        this server instance

      • stop

        public void stop(java.lang.String msg)
        Stops this server.
